Absolutely amazing game. It's nice and simple, short, and to the point. It manages to take a simple idea and craft it into a clever, amsuing, and all around excellent game.  Well worth the play.

[h1] Now You're Thinking With Portals! (Unoriginal Joke Is Unoriginal) [/h1]
[b] Note: This is a rereview, redone in my "new style" of review. [/b]

[b] tl;dr: This game is like a marshmallow: fluffy, tasty, and fun, but it's gone as soon as you get it. [/b]

Portal is Valve's very first puzzle game, but not just any puzzle game, as it sees you being in a testing facility in a first person view and soon after picking up a gun... that shoots portals. All while being talked to by a robot computer lady that very much enjoys sarcasm, snarking and [spoiler] killing humans in her test chambers, or just in general. [/spoiler]

[u] General Overview [/u]
As stated, this is a puzzle game. Each room consists of a puzzle, with each puzzle getting progressively difficult. You start off with just your hands, then a one-way portal device, and finally a dual portal device. There is also a post-campaign advanced mode, consisting of previously completed chambers with a variation that increases difficulty, and a challenge mode, which has you completing previously completed chambers in a set time limit in order to get bronze, silver or gold.

[u] Pros [/u]
- Very fun, and a nice introduction to puzzle games
- Pleasing ambianace and music
- GLaDOS (the robot computer lady) can be quite funny at times
- A unique twist on the Puzzle and FPS genres
- (Mostly) Easy to get achievements

[u] Cons [/u]
- Short game. Assuming you go for only the story, it'll take you 2 hours at best and maybe 4 at worst
- There is only 12 extra challanges, which isn't much bonus content
- [spoiler] The cake is a lie [/spoiler] (Hur hur, another hilarious and original joke)

[u] Nitpicks (That May Detract From Your Overall Enjoyment) [/u]
- Not much music overall
- The achievements have two settings: hard and easy. There is no spectrum.

[b] Conclusion [/b]
Valve made a pretty interesting game here. A Puzzle and FPS hybrid, and it somehow manages to not botch it up. It's amazing to think this was suppose to be a throwaway game in Valve's Orange Box bundle, but instead managed to become one of the most beloved PC games of all time. However, you can definetly feel that this was supposed to be a throwaway game from the story and the post-game content, which ends up leaving the game feel like... a marshmallow. Just one. That you buy at a bake sale. Sure, it's fluffy, tasty, and fun, but as soon as you eat it, it's gone.
Corto pero divertido, nada mas que añadir.

Awesome thinking/puzzle solving game from valve. Single player, good storyline but pretty short and easy to finish. There are extra advanced chambers not associated with the story but again these are quite easy. However you can redo test chambers with challenges such as "least number of portals used to complete" and others, to gain gold on all of them is quite challenging.

The basic puzzle solving for the game is to get from the start of a chamber to the exit by using portals you pass through while getting around obstacles and getting things to work to help you get there. Not as simple and easy as it sounds but fun. The laws of physics are in play and the angle or speed at which an object or you enter the portal is how you will come out the other side and not every surface can have a portal created on it. Have fun testing!!!

+ Logická hra

+ Extra levely

[h1]Für den Preis uneingeschränkte Kaufempfehlung[/h1]
Dieses Spiel sollte jeder ein mal gespielt haben.
Es hebt sich durch seine [b]Portal-Mechanic[/b] und seinen grandiosen [b]Humor[/b] vom Einheitsbrei ab und ist seine 4-5 Stunden Spielzeit durchweg unterhaltend. Ja da habe ich gerade den wunden Punkt dieses Spiels angesprochen: Seine Spielzeit. Aber da es bei den Steam Sales, die ja immer häufiger werden, immer für2-3€ rausgeworfen wird, sollte man zu schlagen.

I really enjoyed this game until I got to level 15 which I could not complete.  I researched and watched the process where you jump, fire an opening, fall through the opening and fire again before landing.  I forget what you were supposed to hit but I must have tried it 500 times without success so I finally gave up and haven't played it again.  I've had it for about a year and a half.

The first Portal game was birthed from the concept project Narbacular Drop made by college students who were hired by Valve after seeing it. Its a very solitary experience in the best way thanks to the top-shelf writing. GLaDOS a hilarious and terrifying disembodied antagonist. I wish there were a way to explore more of Aperture Labs, but you'll have to look towards user made mods for that. Play this game.
I really wanted a cake...

What? You need a review to buy PORTAL? Well if you relly insist. 
    I bought poral afew years before this for the ps3, and going into portal 1 with my knologe of its predecessor, i found the visuals to be alright. They arent exactly the most mind bowing thing on the plannet, but the graphics are offset by the game play. I could list the many reasons why i love this game, but instead you could probubly just use the time it takes to read this to buy the game.

I first played and beat portal when I purchased the orange box for xbox when it first came out.  Having played through it again on steam, I have to say, this game is incredibly fun, unique, and intriguing.  I cannot hype it enough, though I doubt I'll have to considering its popularity.  The only thing that could be constued as a negative of this game, given when it was released and the available hardware and software of the time, would be that it is incredibly short.  That aside this game is an awesome puzzle game and I would reccomend this to anyone who has even the slightest interest in any sort of video games.

[b]9.0/10.0[/b]
